body: It's disabled, and the reason its disabled is probably because one of the settings is either not filled in, or invalid.

If it is disabled due to missing/invalid data, then Syncthing Android has set these invalid data:
the button does not work right after opening the dialog.

So I think the logic for enabling/disabling the button may have an issue.

(However this seems to affect Android only. Never saw such on Win Syncthing.)

On 26. September 2014 23:03:35 MESZ, Audrius Butkevicius notifications@github.com wrote:

> It's disabled, and the reason its disabled is probably because one of
> the settings is either not filled in, or invalid.
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/748#issuecomment-57020141

## 

Diese Nachricht wurde von meinem Android-Tablet mit K-9 Mail gesendet.

`I think:`
It does not work after opening the dialog because nothing has changed. It only gets enabled when something gets changed.

(Thanks for keeping in touch!)
So I toggle one node tick only - should not invalidate the data pattern.
Still, Save button is inactive.

It's inactive because the form data is invalid, or so it thinks. The following things are checked on that form:
- That the repository ID is not blank
- That the repository ID is unique
- That the repository ID only consists of letter, numbers, and the dot/dash/underscore characters.
- That the repository path is not blank
- That the rescan interval is 5 seconds or more

Anything not satisfied by the data (that you're not showing, which would have helped)...?

All above conditions are fulfilled. All fields were filled by the Syncthing App (not via Web GUI).

But by playing around with all my repositories, I found a pattern: paths like 
/storage/emulated/0/... (ASUS)    or    /mnt/sdcard/... (ACER)
do NOT work. Save button is always inactive. But one cannot modify the path once the repository is created, so dead end.
The point is: such paths are generated by the Syncthing for Android App when I navigate and select the target folder.

Work around: create repository using Web GUI and enter paths like
/sdcard/...
instead. This makes the Save button active!

So I think the issue is: on both my devices (Acer E350, ASUS TF300T), the App creates path patterns which will disable the Save button in the Web GUI. This holds at least for folders on the (internal) SD card on the devices mentioned above. [The paths for external SD cards do not show that anomaly.]

Thanks to AudriusButkevicius and calmh for guidance.
That's weird. The only requirement on the path field is that it's not empty...

[I think] Android has some caveats with handling the sdcard paths. Seems to be different on every device - strange enough.

[I think] the Save button is disabled if the path is not _accessible_ - not only if the path field is blank.
[I know] on both my devices, the path field shows the path string the same time the Save button is disabled.

There is no connection between the path being accessible and the state of the save button. This is either not reproducible (you haven't showed the actual data in the dialog, so we can't try) or an android browser bug of some sort.
I reproduced it with built-in browser, Chrome, Firefox, Dolphin - identical behavior everywhere.

Here is the screen shot on ASUS TF300T: (Save inactive)
![screenshot_2014-09-27-22-56-05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8932938/4432172/d9766e46-4688-11e4-850f-8bedde98db47.jpg)

And now the status after entering the "correct" /sdcard path manually: 
Now the Save button is active: (see the darker blue of the button!)
![screenshot_2014-09-27-23-01-19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8932938/4432178/85751c24-4689-11e4-9a66-e6a9b8d34c07.jpg)

I think it makes sense to summarize:
1. created repository in App, navigated path, done.
2. opened Web GUI. /storage/emulated/0/... path is shown. Save button is inactive.
3. deleted repository (in Web GUI) and created it newly, but using /sdcard/... path typed in manually
4. now Save button is active in WebGUI

I bet the issue is "behind the curtain", something with Android paths or symbolic links or some other weird path mapping  - to me, it does not look like a GUI or browser issue.

NOTE: it is all about some mapping of "/sdcard" to something device specific, for ASUS TF300T it is "/storage/emulated/0" - _only_ /sdcard/... is going wrong (which unfortunately is where most of my "interesting" data are...)
"Suchintervall" is gray on the first screenshot, which means not filled, the 60 shown is the default value. Since this is hard to see we should probably remove the gray number here...

rename.to: Don't show default values as placeholders in empty mandatory fields

body:
The repo path shouldn't be a problem. The thing is, I explicitly replace `/sdcard/` (deprecated) with what Android gives as the primary storage path.

And I added "search interval" to 0.5.0, so this shouldn't occur there.

```
Amazing how quickly you nailed that down...

One question left for me:
why is it that the App creates repository objects having an empty "Suchintervall" value when opened in Web GUI?
(App does not show or require "Suchintervall", I assume it takes a default.)

[I am aware that this is a different issue now from what you found and fixed. Yet it is still the phenomenon I saw right from the beginning. So should I create a new thread?]
```

Can you actually reproduce it leaving the value unset?
I know there was a bug, but from what I see in the screenshots, you seem to be running a newer version,

So, I think the deal here is that the old/current version of the Android wrapper saves the config.xml without a rescan interval, which is kind of fine since the config loader defaults it to 60 s. But the web GUI dialog won't allow the save when it's blank, so it's not possible to get into this situation that way. And this should be fixed in v0.5.0 of the Android app as noted above.
